What are the common errors that may occur when running `./verusd` on a Linux distribution, and how can I resolve them?

When running `./verusd` on a Linux distribution, such as Debian or Devuan, you may encounter errors due to uninstalled dependencies. Specifically, you may see the following error messages:
```
error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory
error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory
```
These errors occur because the `libgomp` and `zlib1g-dev` libraries are not installed by default on your Linux distribution. To resolve these errors, you need to install these libraries using the following command:
```
sudo apt-get install libgomp1 zlib1g-dev
```
Once you have installed these libraries, you should be able to run `./verusd` without encountering these errors.

# error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory
# error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory

When running `./verusd` on a Linux distro (eg Debian or Devuan), not all dependencies may be installed by default, resulting in the errormessage `error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory` or `error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory`.

To solve this you need to install the libgomp and zlib1g-dev libraries:
`sudo apt-get install libgomp1 zlib1g-dev`
